* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {
* Abstract class of for other types of command (e.g AddCommand, DeleteCommand, DoneCommand, etc)
* A method to check if the user wants to exit or continue with the programme
* An abstract method to execute a command, given a task and a storage to save any changes
* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException;
* A Delete Command, handle whenever the user wants to delete a Task
* @param index the index of the task that the user wants to delete
* Override abstract method of Command Class
* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {
* A Done Command, handle whenever the user wants to mark a done Task
* @param index the index of the task that the user wants to mark done
* Override abstract method of Command Class
* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {
* An Exit Command, handle whenever the user wants to exit the programme

* Override abstract method of Command Class
* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {
* An Show Command, handle whenever the user wants to show the list of the task
* Override abstract method of Command Class
* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) {
* An Unknown Command, handle whenever the user enters a wrong format of a command
* Override abstract method of Command Class
* execute a Unknown Command, print an error message
* @param storage   the storage to save any changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, AccessHardDisk storage) {

public void markDone(int n, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {
System.out.println("    Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
* Delete a task in the list

* @param storage   storage that access hard disk to save any changes
public void delete(int n, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {
System.out.println("    Noted. I've removed this task: ");
* Add a task into the list

* @param storage   storage that access hard disk to save any changes
public void addTask(Task task, AccessHardDisk storage) throws IOException {

* A class to help handle all the logic of the programme
* @param tasks     the Task List of the user
* Another Constructor of a Parser object, take an empty TaskList
* Another Constructor of a Parser object, take a given TaskList
* Process command from user's CLI, recognize the type of command and its descriptions
public Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The argument of a 'done' command must be a number.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The index of a 'done' command is out of bounce.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The argument of a 'delete' command must be a number.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The index of a 'delete' command is out of bounce.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The description of a 'todo' command is missing.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The description of a 'deadline' command is missing.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! The format for 'deadline' command requires a description " +
"following by </by> notation and a due date.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS! The description of a 'event' command is missing.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! The format for 'event' command requires a description " +
"following by </at> notation and a date time.");
* A class to help handle all the User Interface
* A method to print a line
* A method to print a welcome message
("    Hello I'm Dat\n" + "    What can I do for you?\n" ) +
* A method to print a goodbye message
* A method to print an error message
(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but there is an error :-(") +
* A method to read the next command from user
* @return in string format the command from user
* A method to read a given command
* @param a     a specific string of command
* @return      in string format the command from user
"    What can I do for you?\n" +
(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but there is an error :-(") +
public static void main(String[] args) throws DukeException {
What can I do for you?
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
[D][] deadline kill superman  (by:  the time bat is dead)
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
[E][] event wonder woman dies  (on:  the corpse of superman)
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
[] who the hell event reading this?
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
2. [D][] deadline kill superman  (by:  the time bat is dead)
3. [E][] event wonder woman dies  (on:  the corpse of superman)
4. [] who the hell event reading this?
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
deadline kill superman /by the time bat is dead
event wonder woman dies /at the corpse of superman
who the hell event reading this?
